From @creamstory_official
The very famous Milk cake made popular by celebrity is available right here in Chennai ar Cream Story,Anna Nagar.
 The most moist cake topped with strawberry and pistachio powder and soaked with sweet milk is the most sought after dessert currently here.
 Also their chocolate strawberry made with fresh cut up strawberries and thick molten chocolate makes you want more of these.
 Finally the very famous 5 in 1 torte cake is also available here at various quantity which tasted amazingly good.
 Overall,Cream Story is the place to try out some mouth watering desserts. Also Couples can get additional 10% offer during the month of February from 1-14.

From @haunted_restaurant
Themed restaurants are a much sort out place for people going for an outing with co workers,friends and family and of late themed restaurants are having a huge fan base.
 One of the first few themed restaurants to be introduced in Chennai is Haunted with a chilly,horror experience.
 With a creepy entrance door to the hanging mummies,turning wall clocks,sudden shimmering of lights,horrifying voices and ouija themed tables-this place is surely a pure thriling experience.
 They offer an unlimited buffet with both veg and non veg items.Starters like corn,gopi 65,paneer,fish tikka,prawn etc and mains like noodles,biriyani,fried rice,naan,chicken and mutton gravies are available which tastes really yumm.And the sudden entry a scary devilish character in between meals truly offers a chilly experience to its customers.
 Overall one of the best themed restaurants serving great food and currently offers some good offers on weekdays which should not be missed!

•

From @tiffinshastra 
The recent trending spot in Chennai serving lip smacking vegetarian tiffin items in Bangalore style is Tiffin Shastra located in Anna Nagar.
 With QSR method,a clean and compact ambience,they serve food at the speed of lightening since they are always buzzing with crowd.
 We tried their famous Benne Masala dosa,open benne dosa,neer dosa,podi idly,sambar idly,chow chow bath and kara bath.The crispy butter loaded benne dosa was too good to be true and the food with their Chennai style sambar makes the best pair.
 One of the best places in Chennai to try out some really good vegetarian tiffin items is right here in Anna Nagar!

From @swirlyo_ 
Swirlyo has recently been opened in KNK road-A brand well known for their mouth watering frozen yoghurt desserts.
 The selling point about yoghurt is that it’s healthy,low in calories and probiotic which is good for the gut and even better for our palate.
 I tried their Berry berry which was topped with strawberry and blueberry which was too good.
 Next is their lotus biscoff flavoured yoghurt which was even better.Freshly churned yoghurt and non yoghurt based gelatos are also available 
  Froyo filled brioche,caramel cheesecake frappe are some items on the menu which were mind blowing in flavour.
 Their cheesecakes are something that got me hooked.
 Swirlyo is open till 2 Am and it’s definitely one of the best dessert places to visit.

Tag and Share with your friends and plan to this shopping festival 
Get ready for a festive shopping extravaganza at the Chennai Trade Centre in Nandambakkam!

This January, experience the Pongal Shopping Festival, a vibrant fusion of two exciting fairs under one roof: 

* Thailand Shopping Festival: Immerse yourself in the exotic charm of Thailand, with stalls showcasing beautiful jewelry, trendy clothes, and intricate home decorations. variety of country stalls like Korea, Iran, Nepal, Bangladesh, Afghanistan, Turkey, and India.
* Furniture Fair: Furnish your home in style with incredible deals on sofas, chairs, beds, and dining tables
* 
Over 100 diverse stalls await, bursting with treasures to discover. Whether you’re a jewelry collector, a fashionista, a homemaker, or simply looking for unique gifts, the Pongal Shopping Festival has something for everyone!

Bonus features:
* Free parking: No need to worry about parking fees!
* Delicious food stalls: Refuel between shopping sprees with a variety of delectable treats.
* 
Show your support for skilled artisans! This festival is a fantastic opportunity to appreciate the talent and craftsmanship behind these beautiful creations.

Mark your calendars! Don’t miss the Pongal Shopping Festival at the Chennai Trade Centre in Nandambakkam. It’s the perfect way to celebrate Pongal, indulge in some retail therapy, and support local artists all at once!
•
•

Bring the iconic flavors of Panera’s Broccoli Cheddar Soup to your kitchen! 🥣🥦 It is as delicious, creamy, and cheesy as the original. 🧀 Get the ingredients below and the full recipe details in the @allrecipes bio! 

Ingredients: 
1 tablespoon butter
½ onion, chopped
¼ cup melted butter
¼ cup all-purpose flour
2 cups milk
2 cups chicken stock
1 ½ cups coarsely chopped broccoli florets
1 cup matchstick-cut carrots
1 stalk celery, thinly sliced
2 ½ cups shredded sharp Cheddar cheese
salt and ground black pepper to taste

🧑‍🍳: Natalie @guacmylife

Tag your Vegetarian Friends 😍
Craving a veggie feast fit for royalty? Look no further than Royal Indianaa in Chennai! This 5-star gem explodes with flavor, from the crispy starters and melt-in-your-mouth paneer starters to the Chef Venkatesh Bhat’s signature main courses that are a must-try. All desserts are eggless, so everyone can indulge!
Here’s why Royal Indianaa is the best veg buffet in Chennai:
* Amazing hospitality: The staff treats you like royalty, making you feel welcome and pampered.
* Food that explodes with flavor: The starters, main courses, and desserts are all incredible, with fresh, seasonal ingredients and innovative spice combinations.
* Eggless desserts: Vegans and people with dietary restrictions can enjoy all the delicious desserts without worry.
* 5-star atmosphere: The ambience is elegant and sophisticated, perfect for a special occasion.
Highly recommend Royal Indianaa for an unforgettable vegetarian dining experience!
🔴Don’t miss their pongal buffet happening from

This Marinated Pickle Cheese won’t last long in your fridge! Havarti and sharp cheddar marinated in a hot and sweet pickle vinaigrette make for one perfect bite. Continue reading or click the 🔗 in our @allrecipes bio for the recipe! 🥒

Ingredients:
8 ounces havarti cheese
8 ounces sharp Cheddar cheese
6 ounces cream cheese
2/3 cup finely chopped sweet and spicy dill pickle chips, such as Wickles® Pickles
3 tablespoons finely chopped green onions
1 tablespoon finely chopped fresh dill
1 tablespoon ranch seasoning
1/4 teaspoon crushed red pepper
1/4 cup pickle brine from pickle jar
1/4 cup apple cider vinegar
1/2 cup olive oil

Directions:
Place cheeses in the freezer for 15 minutes while marinade is prepared.

Combine pickles, green onions, dill, ranch seasoning, red pepper, pickle brine, and apple cider vinegar in medium bowl. Stir in olive oil until well blended and set aside.

Cut each block of cheese in half lengthwise, then cut each piece into 1/4-inch slices, to form square pieces. Cut a small piece off of the cream cheese and place it between alternating flavors of cheese. Place the alternating cheese slices on their sides in the bottom of a small casserole dish. This can be done in 2 to 4 rows depending on the size of the dish. 

Pour the reserved marinade over the cheeses, cover, and refrigerate at least 2 hours or up to overnight. Serve with crackers.

🧑‍🍳: Nicole

#pickle #marinatedcheese #cheese #appetizers #appetizerideas partyfood | @allrecipes

From @moonmanrestaurant
One of the newest spots in Chennai getting all the attention is the Space themed Restaurant located right near the Besant Nagar Beach is the “Moonman” portraying how a dinner on the Moon looks like with both the looks and the lighting.
 And the food there is also something that should be given credit to.In started their take on Butter chicken bbq wings was crispy and yum with the right amount of desi twist and The Quesadilla was refreshing and yum.
 In the main,Moroccan grilled chicken is something that will be gobbled by the people who love spices.Alfredo pasta for the Italian Cuisine lovers is also a good dish.
 Chicken Rocket burger with grilled onions,fried egg and the juicy chicken patty is a must try.Thin crust Cajun Bbq pizza was also equally good.
 For the people with a knack for sweets,Belgian thickshake was absolutely yum and Their Newyork styled blueberry cheesecake was the perfect end to a great dining experience.
 A place that must be visited both for the great experience visually and gastronomically.

From @jnove_restaurant 
One of the places that I visited recently that served some good food in a great quantity is Jnove.
 The ambience as such was comfortable and clean which is a good start to any restaurant.Next of had their bucket thokku biriyani with a bucket full of tasty biriyani which is also UNLIMITED coming alongside with a few sides that is worthy of ₹1499.
 For who love tandoori,their chicken tandoori platter is a must try and the mixed non veg platter contains starters which were too good.
 Chicken lung fung soup was also another item which should not be missed and in desserts their puttu ice cream was yummy.
 They also serve other kinds of biriyani like barbeque biriyani,mutton chukka,prawn thokku etc
  A place worthy giving a try for their affordable prices and food with a great taste.

Tag your gang and plan a hangout here
From @emptea_pocket 
One of the recent new hangout spot in Anna Nagar run by a group of friends who came up with a unique name “Emptea Pocket”.
 With an ambience that is not usually found in tea shops,they offer tea and coffee at the same price but with a clean and appealing ambience.
 I had their Emptea special tea served in a cute pot with spices being mixed right is a delight.Hot chocolate is something that not all places get right but they got it right with their texture,smoothness and flavour.Their special coffee made with their unique blend is also too good.
 Out of the snacks,loaded bread omelette with cheese loaded on top is an absolute must try.
 Bun butter jam-their bun was too soft and both in combination along with the condensed milk drizzle on top was mouth watering.Their Nutella  chocolate bun is also a must try.
 Overall,a spot to let your worries of the day fizzle out along with a cup of tea.

Sheet Pan Quesadillas are your next one-pan wonder! 🌮 Bonus tip: baking them under a second sheet helps the stuffed tortillas turn golden and crisp on the outside, with melted cheesy goodness inside. 🤤

Get the full recipe details in the link in @allrecipes bio! 

Ingredients: 
1 tablespoon olive oil
1 onion, chopped
1 green bell pepper, chopped
1 red bell pepper, chopped
1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast, chopped
2 tablespoons water
1 (1.1-ounce) package fajita seasoning mix
8 (8-inch) flour tortillas
2 cups shredded Mexican cheese blend
4 tablespoons sour cream, for serving
4 tablespoons pico de gallo, or to taste
2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro, for garnish*
(*Nicole doubled the ingredients to serve more from a bigger sheet pan)

🧑‍🍳: Nicole @nicolemcmom

From @mangochakka_chennai 
For tasting Kerala and Tamil Nadu cuisine at a reasonable price,The newly opened Mangochakka is one of the worthy places to try out.
 It has a good and comfortable ambience with seating and we started with the Typical kerala kappa vadai which was too good and brought out the kerala flavour
  Trivandrum fried chicken,mutton chukka and seeraga samba chicken biriyani was a feast and how could one not try the Malabar parotta in a Kerala restaurant.That with mutton vellai korma was a match made in heaven.
 Chennai pattinam meen curry and red rice was another delight and ended the meal with coconut pudding.
 One of the fewest place in Chennai serving mouth watering kerala cuisine at a really resounding rate.Check them out!
•
•

Kappa vadai - ₹240
Trivandrum fried chicken - ₹280
Mutton sukka - ₹300

Kerala parotta - ₹50
Mutton vellai korma - ₹280
Coconut pudding - ₹375

Tag your IT Gang
Centre Point, situated on OMR, is a well-maintained 3-star property that is conveniently located for IT professionals. It offers a lounge bar, restaurant, party hall, and stay options all in one place.
The spacious and comfortable bar serves cocktails and has live music every Wednesday, as well as DJ nights every Friday, Saturday, and Sunday. It also screens cricket matches, making it a perfect spot to hang out.
Famous Theory, located within the hotel, serves amazing food. Some of the must-try dishes include mocktails, veg and prawn tempura sushi, chicken cheese boti kebab, Sizzling Shankara fish fry, paneer butter masala, and kulcha.
The hotel also offers stay options, with neatly maintained and comfortable rooms that offer room service. Centre Point is a good option for business meetings, as well as a great place to stay and relax.

From @b.g.naidu_sweets 
One of the most well known brand in Tamil Nadu is BG Naidu Sweets.They are known for their mouth watering sweets and savouries especially around the time of festive occasions.
 In their Diwali hamper,there was their Signature Ghee cake-soft and fluffy,one of the best.The assorted sweet box containing mango soan papdi,badam rose laddoo,gulkand biscuit were unique sweets from them.Then kadalai mittai,ellu urundai,adhirasam were all fresh and too good and brought the festive vibes at the first bite.
 Their savory items such as milk and masala rusk,murukku,thattai,mixture and soup sticks were also equally good.
 Get your hamper this Diwali from their website and kickstart the Celebration with loads of sweet and happiness!

From @jkans_foods
Jkans in Medavakkam has been serving delicious food at reasonable prices for quite some time. Its spacious and clean ambience attracts more customers to the place.
We started off with their mushroom 65 and baby corn Manchurian, which are items that vegetarians will definitely love. For non-vegetarians, the dragon chicken, Vanjaram fish fry, and prawn thokku are sure to make you lick your fingers wanting more.
Jkans is also well known for its grilled and barbecued chicken. What’s more unique is that they serve their most-loved side dish, mayonnaise, in a small bucket, which is an additional reason to visit.
I got addicted to the mutton thokku biryani, and their chicken shawarma, Madurai-style curry dosai, and suspense fried rice were all so good that they are hard to put into words.
Overall, Jkans is one of the most worthwhile restaurants to visit recently to explore and taste the most delicious food!

Ingredients:

2 ½ cups - Maida (Refined Flour)
1 ½ cups - Castor Sugar
1 tsp - Baking powder
2 tsp - Soda bi-carb
½ tsp - Salt
1 cup - Amul Dahi (Curd)
2 - Eggs
¼ cup - Cocoa Powder
1 cup - Refined Oil 
1 ½ tsp - Vanilla Essence
1 cup - Boiling Water
3 cups - Unsalted Butter
3 cups - Icing Sugar
Assorted - Food Colours
Few - Maraschino Cherries
1 bar - Dark Chocolate
200ml - Whipping Cream

Method:

1. Preheat oven to 180*C. Grease a muffin tin.
2. Sift flour, baking powder and soda bicarb. Divide into two portions.
3. Combine sieved cocoa powder with one portion.
4. Beat eggs till fluffy and pale yellow. Add castor sugar and beat some more. Add Amul dahi and refined oil and vanilla essence and beat.
5. Divide into two portions.

Red Thai Curry 

Ingredients
15 nos.    Dried Red Chillies (boiled)
5 -6 nos.   Shallots (roughly chopped)
6 tbsp    Ramdev Coriander seeds
8 – 10 cloves   Garlic 
6-7 nos.    Fresh Coriander stalks (finely chopped)
3 - 4 nos.   Fresh Bird Eye chillies (3 for the paste, 1 for garnish)
3-4 stalks   Lemon Grass (with bulb) (finely chopped)
2 tbsp    Oil
2 nos.    Star Anise
2” piece   Galangal (sliced)
5 -6 leaves   Fresh Basil (reserve 1 sprig for garnish)
1 nos. (medium-sized)  Carrots (diced)
3-4 nos.    Baby Corn (sliced)
1 nos. (small)   Green Zucchini (diced)
1 nos. (small)   Yellow Zucchini (diced)
1 nos.    Red Capsicum (diced)
1 nos.     Yellow Capsicum (diced)
1 nos.    Green Capsicum (diced)
4 nos.    Shiitake Mushrooms (soaked and sliced)
2 pieces    Bamboo Shoots (sliced)
400 ml    Coconut Milk
To taste    Salt
To taste    Ramdev Black Pepper powder
1 tsp    Lemon juice

Method
1.  Using a Kenwood Mixer Grinder, grind the dry red chillies, shallots, coriander seeds, garlic, fresh coriander stalks, bird eye chillies (reserving 1 for garnish) and lemon grass to a paste. Remove into a bowl and keep aside.
2.  Heat oil in a wok. When oil starts smoking, fry the fresh chilli kept for garnish, remove and keep aside. Then add the star anise and galangal and stir-fry for a few seconds. 
3.  Add the ground paste and fry well on a high flame, stirring constantly for about 3 minutes till the aroma fills the air.
4.  Then add carrots and baby corn and stir-fry for about a minute.  Toss in the green and yellow zucchini and stir –fry for about 2 minutes.
5.  Toss in the red, yellow and green capsicum with the shiitake mushrooms and bamboo shoots and stir-fry for 1 more minute.
6.  Mix in the coconut milk and keep stirring the mixture constantly till it comes to a boil. Once the curry boils, reduce the flame and simmer for 2 more minutes. Mix in salt, pepper, then remove curry from the flame and add lemon juice.
7.  To serve, place a ring mould in the centre of a soup plate. Scoop out vegetables from the curry and spoon inside the ring mould. Ladle the gravy around the mould. Place a basil sprig and fried chilli on the vegetables, remove the ring mould and serve immediately with steamed rice.

This one goes out to the cream cheese lovers out there... 🤤 For the perfect love letter to cream cheese, this Block of Cream Cheese Lemon Chicken Pasta comes together quickly and is bright, rich, and creamy! 🧡🍋

Keep reading for the full recipe details, or click the link in the @allrecipes bio. 

Ingredients: 
1 pound skinless, boneless chicken thighs, cut into thin strips
3 cups uncooked cavatappi pasta
2 1/2 cups chicken stock
2 ounces freshly grated Parmesan cheese, plus more for garnish
2 teaspoon grated lemon zest
2 large cloves garlic, minced
1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt
1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese
1 1/2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice
Finely chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley, for garnish (optional)

Directions:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Add chicken, pasta, chicken stock, Parmesan cheese, lemon zest, garlic, and salt to a 13x9-inch baking dish. Stir until evenly combined, and pasta is mostly submerged in liquid. Nestle cream cheese in the center of the baking dish and tightly cover with aluminum foil.

2. Bake in the preheated oven until pasta is almost tender, about 40 minutes. Remove from the oven and stir pasta around the edges of the baking dish. Cover with foil and return to the oven. 

3. Bake until sauce is bubbling around the edges and pasta is tender, about 10 minutes more. Remove from the oven and discard foil. Stir until cream cheese melts into a smooth sauce.

4. Drizzle with lemon juice. Top with more Parmesan and garnish with fresh parsley. Serve immediately.

🧑‍🍳: @craigruff_ 
#easypasta #pastarecipes #creamcheese #easyrecipes #lemonpasta

Makes 4 servings

For Kofta 
2 medium bunches (1200 grams / 2.6 pounds) fresh spinach
1 small bunch fresh bathua
1 small bunch fresh mustard leaves
½ small bunch fresh fenugreek leaves
10 fresh radish leaves
¼ small bunch fresh red amaranth                                            
¼ small bunch fresh green amaranth
2 tablespoons (30 ml) + 1 quart (800 ml) vegetable oil
1 teaspoon cumin seeds
10-12 garlic cloves, finely chopped     
6-7 green chiles, stemmed and finely chopped   
1 ? teaspoon table salt
¼ teaspoon ground turmeric 
4 tablespoons besan (gram flour)
1 litre cow’s milk
A few saffron strands
2 tablespoons vinegar
? teaspoon green cardamom powder
¼ cup (30 grams / 1 ounce) cornstarch

Method:

1. Trim all the leafy greens and wash under running water. Place a deep non stick pan over medium heat and add 8 cups (1.6 litres) of water and bring it to a boil.
2. Add the leaves and blanch it in boiling hot water for 2-3 minutes. Drain in colander and refresh under cold water. Squeeze out the excess water, cool and puree. Transfer into a deep bowl.
3. Place a non stick shallow pan on medium heat and pour in 2 tablespoons (30 ml) oil.  When small bubbles appear at the bottom of the pan, add the cumin seeds, garlic and chiles and sauté.  Add 1 teaspoon salt and turmeric and stir.  Add gram flour and continue to sauté for 1-2 minutes.  Add the prepared puree and sauté, stirring continuously, until the mixture is dry and begins to leave the sides of the pan.  Set aside to cool.  Divide into 8 equal portions.
4. Take cow’s milk  in a deep pan, add saffron strands to it and let it come to a boil. Take pan off the heat and add vinegar, once the milk curdles, strain it in a muslin, set the whey aside, do not discard.
5.  Dip it in a bowl of ice water to cool the chenna.
6. Remove the muslin with chenna from the water and squeeze out excess water.
7. In another bowl mash the chenna along with ? teaspoon salt and ? teaspoon green cardamom powder. Divide into 8 equal portions and roll into balls.
8. Take a portion of the sautéed greens, flatten it on your palm and place a chenna ball in the center.  Gather the edges and shape into a ball. Similarly prepare the remaining koftas.
9. Spread the cornstarch in a plate and rolls the stuffed koftas balls in it.  Shake off the excess.
10. Place a kadai (wok) on high heat and pour in 1 quart (800 ml) oil.  When small bubbles appear at the bottom of the wok, reduce heat to low and gently slide in the koftas.  Cook for 2-3 minutes or till golden brown.  Drain with a slotted spoon and place on an absorbent paper.  Use as required.

Chocolate Coffee Cupcakes 

Ingredients:
1 ½ cups self-raising flour, sifted
1 tablespoon instant coffee powder
200 g dark chocolate, chopped
2 cups caster sugar
250 g butter
1 ½ cups hot water
2 eggs
½ tsp vanilla essence
Ingredients for Chocolate icing 
125 g dark cooking chocolate
125 g unsalted butter
Ingredients for Royal Icing
Egg white - 1
Sugar – 150 gms
Method:
1. Preheat an oven to 180C/350F/Gas 4.  Grease and flour 12 cup cake moulds.
2. Place the chocolate in a small pan along with the sugar, butter and water and heat gently over a pan of simmering water, until the chocolate and butter melt. Cool and pour into a blender. 
3. Gradually add the sifted flour into the blender and blend till well mixed. Add the eggs, one at a time, then add the vanilla and blend well. 
4. Spoon the batter into the prepared moulds and bake in the preheated oven for about 20 minutes, or until a skewer inserted comes out clean. Leave to stand for about 5 minutes. 
5. For the icing, melt the chocolate and butter in a small pan over a pan of simmering water, and beat with a wooden spoon until smooth. Spread the icing over the cupcakes and mark grooves with a fork for a decorative finish.

Marshmallows 
Ingredients:
250 gm  Cornflour (for dusting)
250 gm  Icing Sugar (for dusting)
1120 gm  Caster Sugar
3 tblsp  Corn Syrup
1½ cups  Water
6 nos.  Egg Whites
24 nos.  Gelatin sheets
6 tblsp  Kewra Water
A few drops Yellow Food Colour

Method:

1. Sift the cornflour and icing sugar together in a bowl and keep aside. Dust a greased silicon mat with half the prepared mixture.
2. Combine the caster sugar, corn syrup and water in a saucepan and cook without stirring till the mixture reaches a temperature of 128ºC. 
3. When the mixture reaches 120ºC, start whisking the egg whites on full speed in the Kitchen Aid. 
4. In a mixing bowl, soak the gelatin sheets in cold water for about 2 to 3 minutes till they soften. Meanwhile in another pan, heat the kewra water, add the soaked gelatin to it and dissolve on a low flame.
5. When sugar – corn syrup mixture reaches 128ºC, remove from flame and add in gelatin mixture. Gradually add the sugar-gelatin mixture into the egg whites with the machine operating at low speed.
6. Continue whisking the egg whites till all the sugar-gelatin mixture is incorporated, mix in the food colour and whisk only till the colour mixes evenly and stop whisking.
7.  Pour the marshmallow mixture evenly over the dusted tray and lightly dust with remaining cornflour-icing sugar mixture. Keep aside for 15 to 20 minutes till marshmallows have set. 
8. When marshmallow sets, cut into squares using square ring cutters.

Glazed Doughnuts
Ingredients: 
56 gm   Dry Yeast
2 cup   Maida
2 cups   Warm Water
120 gm   Butter
150 gm   Sugar
6 nos.   Eggs
4 tsp   Vanilla essence
2 tsp   Salt
2 tblsp   Orange Zest
7 cups   Maida
As required  PAM spray
(for deep frying) Oil
1 bowl   Glaze
A few drops  Green Food Colour
½ cup   Silver balls

Method:

1. In a mixing bowl, combine the dry yeast with maida, pour in the warm water, mix gently, cover and keep aside for 10 minutes.
2. In the Kitchen Aid, with a paddle attachment, cream the butter and caster sugar till it is light and creamy. Mix in the eggs one by one and continue whisking. Also mix in the vanilla essence, salt and orange zest. Gently fold in 7 cups of maida and also add in the proofed dough. Keep aside in a warm place to proof again till dough doubles.
4. Divide into half, dust the counter with flour and roll the dough out to ½ inch thickness and cut into doughnut shapes. Keep aside to proof again.
5. Keep oil to heat in a kadhai. Spray the cut doughnuts with PAM spray. When oil is hot enough, deep fry the doughnuts till golden, remove and drain on absorbent paper. Keep aside to cool slightly.
6. In a mixing bowl, mix the glaze with a few drops of green food colour to get the desired shade. (The glaze can be thinned down slightly using a few drops of water if required). Dip the doughnuts in the glaze and sprinkle over with silver balls immediately. Keep aside till glaze sets.
Brownies
Ingredients:
100 gm   Butter
100 gm             Dark Chocolate Chips
150 gm               Sugar
3 large             Eggs
¼ tsp                Vanilla essence
100 gm             Flour
¾ tsp               Baking powder
75 gm             Walnuts (broken)
Method:
1. Preheat oven to 180ºC. In a mixing bowl, sift flour and baking powder together and keep aside. 
2. Heat water in a pot. In a saucepan, combine the butter with chocolate, place in the frying pan and heat gently till chocolate melts and mixes thoroughly with the butter.
3. Mix in sugar and beat till completely dissolved. Remove from flame and keep aside.
4. In a clean dry glass bowl whisk eggs with vanilla essence till double in volume, fold into butter mixture.
5. Fold in sifted flour and baking powder. Also fold in chopped walnuts.
6. Pour into a greased and lined baking tray and bake for 40 minutes or till crust is crisp. To test for doneness, insert a wooden skewer in the centre of the brownie cake, if it comes out clean, remove cake from the oven and place on a cooling rack.
7. After 15 minutes turn out the cake from the tin onto a cooling rack and leave to cool. When cool, cut into desired shape.

Paneer & Pepper Satay with Peanut Sauce

Ingredients:

For the Satay
200 gm            Red Curry paste
1 tbsp            Brown sugar
2 tsp            Cumin powder
2 tsp             Coriander powder
1 tbsp            Turmeric powder
1 tbsp            Lemon grass (finely chopped)
2 tbsp            Kaffir Lime leaves (finely chopped)
600 ml            Coconut Milk
3 tbsp            Light Soya sauce
1 nos.            Onion (cut into large dices)
1 nos.            Red Capsicum (cut into large dices)
1 nos.            Yellow Capsicum (cut into large dices)
1 nos.            Green Capsicum (cut into large dices)
500 gm            Paneer (cut into cubes)
2 tsp            Oil

For the Peanut sauce
100 gm            Red Curry paste
100 gm            Roasted Peanut powder
2 tbsp            Kaffir Lime leaves (finely chopped)
3 tbsp            Lemon grass (finely chopped)
1 tbsp            Turmeric powder
1 tbsp            Light Soya sauce
1 tbsp            Tamarind paste
2 tbsp            Palm Sugar (or Jaggery)
120 ml            Coconut Milk
2 tsp            Sesame oil
2 tbsp            Oil
2 cloves        Garlic (finely chopped)
To serve
5 nos.            Satay sticks (soaked)

Method:

1. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the curry paste, brown sugar, cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric, lemon grass, lime leaves, coconut milk and light soya sauce. Whisk very well and keep aside for 5 minutes for flavours to blend well.
2. Add in the onion, red, yellow and green capsicum and paneer and toss gently to coat vegetables and paneer with marinade.
3. Drain the satay sticks and skewer the vegetables and paneer alternately on them. Refrigerate for 20 minutes.
4. Meanwhile, in another mixing bowl, whisk together the curry paste, peanut powder, lime leaves, lemon grass, turmeric, light soya sauce, tamarind paste, palm sugar and coconut milk. Whisk well, mix in sesame oil and keep aside for 5 minutes to allow flavours to blend well.
5. Heat oil in a saucepan, add garlic and sauté till garlic softens. Add the sauce mixture and cook stirring continuously for 10 to 15 minutes till sauce thickens and turns glossy. When done, remove from flame and keep aside.
6. Heat 2 tsp oil in a grill pan, place refrigerated skewers on it and grill turning constantly over a medium flame for 5 to 7 minutes till vegetables and paneer are properly grilled.

Ingredients:

For the Chocolate Sphere:

1 kg - Chocolate
For greasing - Amul Butter
1 box - Edible Gold Dust
For dusting - Cocoa Powder

For the Nariyal aur Rewdi ka Chura:

50g - Amul Butter
100g - Desiccated Coconut
50g - Castor Sugar (for crumble)
300g - Castor Sugar (for caramel)
100g - Sesame Seeds
50g - Maida (Refined Flour)

For the kacha Gola Santre ke Swad Mein:

500g - Chenna 
100g - Castor Sugar
Few drops - Orange Food Colour
1 - Malta Orange

For the Pudina aur Khus ke Doodh ke Moti:

10ml - Khus Syrup 
100g - Mawa (Milk Solids)
Few drops - Green Food Colour
Few Leaves - Pudina

For the Santre ka Ras:

1 - Santre ka Ras (Juice of 1 Orange) 
50ml - Brandy

For the Phaldari Chaat:

1 - Watermelon
1 - Mango
1 - Musk Melon
Few - Blueberries 
Few leaves - Pudina (Mint)

For the Sugar Nest:

300g - Castor Sugar

For the Phirni:

50g - Rice Flour
500ml - Amul Milk
Few drops - Pink Food Colour
6 - Gelatin Leaves
To taste - Elaichi (Green Cardamom) Powder
60g - Castor Sugar
1 can (400ml) - Coconut Cream (thick coconut extract)


Method:

To make the chocolate sphere: 

1. Melt chocolate on a double boiler and temper.
2. Grease the inside of the aluminium moulds with Amul Butter and line with cling film
3. Pour the tempered chocolate into the mould  
4. Coat all over and remove the excess chocolate
5. Keep aside to set.

To make the Nariyal aur Rewdi Chura:

1. Make caramel, by melting castor sugar
2. Add roasted sesame seeds to the sugar and Make rewdi and keep aside
3. Roast the maida and set aside
4. Rub the chilled and cubed butter into the maida and desiccated coconut until the mixture resembles bread crumbs. Then mix in castor sugar.
5. Crush the Rewdi and toasted almonds and add to the crumbs.
6. Place in an oven proof dish and bake at 150°C for five minutes. Do not allow it to brown or colour.
7. Set aside to cool

To make the Kacha Gola Santre ke Swad main:

1. Knead the chhena, with the orange rind and the orange colour.
2. Make marble sized balls and place on the back of a flour dusted thali.

To make the Pudine aur khas ke dudh ke moti:

1. Knead Mawa with khus syrup, green colour and mint essence.
2. Add a few chopped mint leaves.
3. Roll into tiny beads and set aside

To make the Santre ka Ras:

1. Soak orange rind in Cognac and keep aside.

To make the Phaldhari Chaat:

1. Using a melon baller, scoop out balls of the musk melon, the watermelon and the mango and keep aside.
2. Prepare a glaze with honey and gelatin and brush all the fruits with it
3. Pluck tiny mint leaves and keep aside.

To make the Sugar Nest:

1. Melt sugar in a saucepan till lightly golden to make caramel.
2. Using a fork, stretch the sugar in strands over a silicone mat to create a web like effect. Draw the sugar together and create a spun ball.

To make the Phirni:

1. Cook the Rice flour with the milk and add sugar to make a rice phirni.
2. Add rose water and rose essence and rose pink colour.
3. Add a little water to the gelatin and allow it to bloom. 
4. Mix half the gelatin with the phirni.
5. Simmer the coconut cream and add the remaining gelatin to it.
6. Spread the phirni and the coconut cream in layers one on top of the other in a swiss roll or baking tray and allow to set.

To assemble:

1. Place the sugar nest on the plate.
2. Demould the chocolate sphere and dust it with Cocoa Powder
3. Place one mould on top of the Sugar Nest
4. Fill it up with the Nariyal and Rewdi ka Chura
5. Place the kacha golas carefully on top.
6. Place the Phirni cubes and the motis on this.
7. Cover with the other Chocolate mould and Seal with some melted chocolate.
8. Dust with Edible Gold Dust
9. Place on the Tile.
10. Arrange the Phalahari Chaat and the mint leaves around it.
11. Just before serving, flambé the Sauce and Pour over the Chocolate Sphere to melt.

Ingredients:

2 fillets - Basa Fish
30g - Amul Gouda Cheese
30g - Amul Processed Cheese
30g - Amul Mozzarella Cheese 
100g - Carrots, scooped into rounds
100g - French Beans, sliced
100g - Broccoli, cut into florets

For the marinade:

3 sticks - Mulethi
To taste - Garam Masala
1 tsp - Adrak (Ginger)
2 tbsp - Imli (Tamarind) Pulp
1 tbsp - Asian Sesame Oil
To taste - Kali Mirch (Black Pepper) Powder
1 tbsp - Sugar
To taste - Lal Mirch (Red Chili) Powder 
To taste - Salt

For the Fruit Sauce:

1 - Anar (Pomegranate), juiced
1 cup - Kokum Extract
1 tbsp - Honey
To taste - Sugar
To taste - Salt
To taste - Chaat masala

Equipment:

1 - Coal Iron
3kg - Coal

Method:

1. Make slits in the side of the fillets to stuff later.
2. Boil the mulethi in water to extract the flavour. 
3. Marinade the fillets in the spices and the mulethi extract for 30 minutes.
4. Heat coal.
5. To make the sauce: Boil all the ingredients together till thick 
6. To grill the fish: Stuff the marinated fish with the 3 Amul cheeses.
7. Then wrap the fillets in aluminum foil. Press the iron on that till cooked.
8. Blanch the vegetables and sauté in oil.
9. Serve the fish with the fruit sauce and vegetables.

Ingredients:

For the Hakka Noodles: 

1 pkt - Noodles
1 - Yellow Bell Pepper
1 - Red Bell Pepper
1 - Green Capsicum
1/2 - Cabbage
2 - Carrots
2 - Onions
4 cloves - Lehsun (Garlic)
2 - Spring Onions 
To taste - Soy Sauce
To taste - White Vinegar
To taste - Salt
To taste - Pepper

For the Sesame Chicken:

1 - Onions
6 cloves - Lehsun (Garlic)
3 - Bird’s Eye Chilies  
To taste - Soy Sauce
To taste - Honey
1 tbsp - Corn Starch
To taste - Salt
To taste - Pepper
1 - Spring Onion

For the salt and pepper baby corn:

1 pkt - Baby Corn
3 cloves - Lehsun (Garlic)
½ - Onion
50g - Amul Paneer, cut into strips
1 - Spring Onion
To taste - Salt
To taste - Pepper
As required - Oil

Method:

1. To make the hakka noodles: Sauté the onion, lehsun and all sliced vegetables with some oil till the all vegetables are done. 
2. Mix the noodles with the cook vegetables and add soya sauce, vinegar, salt and pepper.
3. Garnish with juliennes of spring onion
4. To make the sesame chicken: Heat some oil in a pan and then sauté chopped lehsun, onion and bird’s eye chilli. 
5. Add the chicken and fry a little
6. And then add water to it for a little gravy.  
7. Add soya sauce, salt and pepper.
8. Add corn starch at the end to thicken the sauce. 
9. Garnish with toasted sesame seeds.
10.  To make the Salt and Pepper Baby Corn: Heat oil in a pan and then add lehsun, onion sauté it. 
11. Add the baby corn, Amul paneer and salt, pepper and fry. 
12. Garnish with spring onion.

How to prepare a delicious eton mess bombe.

Ingredients:

1 box - Whipping Cream
2 - Oranges
100g - Castor Sugar
½ kg - Milk Chocolate
1 stick - Cinnamon
200g - White Chocolate

Method:

1. Zest and pulp the oranges.
2. Whip the chilled cream and melt the chocolate over a double boiler.
3. Fold the melted chocolate and orange zest into the whipped cream. 
4. Reduce the Orange pulp with water, sugar and cinnamon in a pan. 
5. Fill the mousse into cups and place in the fridge to set for 1 hour.
6. To serve, top up with orange pulp and some white chocolate.

Ingredients:

For the special masala:

2 tbsp - Dhanya (Coriander Seeds)
2 tbsp - Jeera (Cumin)
¼ tsp - Jaiphal (Nutmeg)
1 - Badi Elaichi (Black Cardamom)
5 - Choti Elaichi (Green Cardamom)
1 stick - Dalchini (Cinnamon)
6 - Laung (Cloves)
2 - Javitri (Mace)
1 - Chakraphool (Star Anise)
1 tbsp - Sookhi Gulab ke Pankhudia (Dry Rose Petals)

For the kofta:

500g - Mutton Keema (Mutton Mince)
7 - Eggs
1 tbsp - Khus Khus (White Poppy Seeds), fried and ground into a paste
3 tbsp - Channa (Chickpeas), fried and ground
1 tbsp - Hara Dhanya (Fresh Coriander)
½ tsp - Paprika Powder
2 tsp - Special Masala

For the gravy: 

2 - Onions
8 cloves - Lehsun (Garlic)
½” piece - Adrak (Ginger) 
½ tsp - Lal Mirch (Red Chili) Powder
¼ tsp - Haldi (Turmeric)
10-12 - Kaju (Cashews)
2 tsp - Khus Khus (White Poppy Seeds)
2 tbsp - Amul Fresh Cream
4 - Tomatoes
2 tsp - Special Masala
2 tbsp - Amul Ghee

For the zaffrani pulao: 

1 cup - Basmati Rice
½ tsp - Kesar (Saffron)
2 tsp - Saunf (Fennel Seeds)
1 - Choti Elaichi (Green Cardamom)
1 - Small Onion, chopped
2 tsp - Sookhi Gulab ke Pankhudia (Dry Rose Petals)

Method:

1. To make the special masala: Dry roast all ingredients and grind.
2. To make the Kofta: Boil 6 eggs for 10 minutes.
3. Mix all the ingredients thoroughly in the keema. 
4. Peel the shell off the eggs and pack a layer of about ½ an inch of keema around each one.
5. Whisk the remaining egg.
6. Fill up to half a kadai with oil and heat.
7. Dip the keema coated eggs in the egg batter and deep fry.
8. To make the gravy: Make a paste of onion, lehsun and adrak. 
9. Melt ghee in a pan and add the paste of onion, adrak and garlic and fry till golden brown. 
10. Make a paste of kaju and khus khus. And mix with the onion paste. 
11. Now add lal mirch powder, haldi, dhanya powder and special masala. 
12. Add tomato puree and fry well. 
13. Add cream and fry for 3 minutes more.
14. Add water and salt and boil for 8-10 minutes. 
15. Cut the kofta lengthways in half (So that it resembles an eye) and place atop the gravy. 
16. To make the Zaffrani pulao: Boil the choti elaichi, sookhi gulab in 2 cups of water.
17. Strain out the ingredients and cook the rice in the same water.
18. Add kesar and salt right at the end.
19. Cut thin slices of the onion and fry in hot oil till golden brown.
20. Sprinkle the onion brista over the zaffrani pulao.
21. Serve your Nargisi Kofta and gravy with Zaffrani Pulao.

Ingredients:

For the Aloo Spring Rolls:

1 - Green Apple
150g - Aloo Jeera
1 - Chukandar (Beetroot)
50g - Bread Crumbs
To taste - Salt
To taste - Jeera (Cumin)
¼ tsp - Garam Masala Powder
To taste - Lal Mirch (Red Chili) Powder
100g - Amul Paneer (Cottage Cheese)

For the Gnocchi:

1 - Chicken Breast
1 cup - Maida (Refined Flour)
1 tsp - Kali Mirch
To taste - Garlic Salt
To taste - Herbs (Basil, Oregano)
150g - Aloo Jeera
2 tsp - Maida (Refined Flour)
2 tsp - Butter
½ cup - Amul Milk
2 tbsp - Amul Cream 
To taste - Nutmeg
To taste - Salt

For the Tortellini:

1 cup - Maida (Refined Flour)
1 tsp - Olive Oil
1 tbsp - Amul Cream
1 tbsp - Milk
To taste - Salt
100g - Amul Paneer
5 cloves - Lehsun (Garlic)
1 tbsp - Amul Butter
1 - Green Apple
Few - Cherry Tomatoes

Method:

1. To make the aloo spring rolls: Add bread crumbs to aloo jeera and roll out in the form of a chapatti.  
2. Chop Amul paneer, chukandar and green apple and mix.
3. Place some of this mixture in the centre of the aloo jeera chapatti and roll.
4. Set aside in the fridge for 15 minutes. 
5. Cut the roll into cubes return to the fridge for another15 minutes.
6. Remove and fry over medium heat and serve.
7. To make the gnocchi: Add madia, salt, kali mirch to the aloo jeera.
8. Make a dough of it and roll out into a long thick strip and cut into small cubes (gnocchi)
9. Sauté chicken with garlic salt and herbs. 
10. In another pot boil the aloo jeera gnocchi.
11. Make a white sauce by lightly roasting 2 teaspoon madia with butter.
12. Slowly add the Amul milk while stirring continuously.
13. Cook the sauce till it thickens and then add salt, kali mirch, nutmeg and Amul cream mix well.
14. Toss the chicken and gnocchi in the sauce till lightly coated. 
15. To make the Tortellini: Take oil, madia and add Amul cream, salt and milk to make a dough.
16. Knead and set aside for 10 minutes and then roll it out in the shape of a small chapatti.
17. Chop the mixed vegetables and add paneer and mash lightly..
18. Cut squares of the tortellini and spoon the mixture onto it.
19. Fold the square diagonally and then bring the ends together over the centre and pinch shut.
20. Heat vegetable or chicken stock and boil the tortellini in it for 5-7 minutes until cooked properly.
21. Roast garlic, green apple and cherry tomatoes sprinkle over the gnocchi.
22. Serve the spring rolls with the gnocchi and the tortellini.

Marinated eggs are everywhere right now, so we had to give some extra attention to our well-loved Korean marinated hard-boiled eggs! 🥚 These mouthwatering bites are the perfect balance of spicy and salty with just a hint of sweetness. Try them for yourself to see why it’s been voted “a keeper” by recipe reviewers on our site. Get the full recipe below or at the link in the @allrecipes bio. ⬆️

Ingredients:
1 cup soy sauce
1 cup water
¼ cup sugar
3 medium green onions, chopped
2 medium jalapeno peppers, seeded and diced
1 tablespoon minced garlic
2 teaspoons toasted sesame seeds
12 large hard-boiled eggs, peeled
3 teaspoons sesame oil

Directions: 
1. Combine soy sauce, water, sugar, green onions, jalapeno, garlic, and sesame seeds together in a large bowl. Add eggs to the bowl, cover, and refrigerate for 8 hours to overnight.

2. Remove eggs from the refrigerator. Slice in half and place on a serving platter. Spoon some of the marinade over top and drizzle with sesame oil to serve.

🧑‍🍳: Nicole @nicolemcmom

Your New Years Eve showstopper...
Say hello to BEEF WELLINGTON ✨ 

(We think even Gordon would be proud) 
>>> jamieol.com/JOBeefWellington

Ingredients:

For Cheese Muthiya:

1 cup - Besan (Gram Flour)
1tbsp - Gehu ka Ata (Wheat Flour)
1 cup - Methi (Fenugreek leaves), finely chopped
2 - Hari Mirch (Green Chilli), finely chopped
1 bunch - Hara Dhanya (Fresh Coriander)
2 tsp - Ajwain (Carom Seeds)
2 tsp - Jeera (Cumin)
2 tsp - Dhanya (Coriander Seed) Powder
3 tsp - Saunf (Fennel Seeds)
3tsp - Safed Til (Sesame Seeds)
2 pinches - Hing (Asofoetida)
1tsp - Haldi (Turmeric)
2 tsp - Lal Mirch (Red Chilli) Powder
1tsp - Garam Masala
200g - Amul Mozzarella Cheese
2 tbsp - Amul Ghee
1 pinch - Baking powder
To fry - Oil
To taste - Salt

For Lasaniya Bateka nu Shak:

3 - Potatoes
5 - Sookhi Lal Mirch (Dried Red Chilli)
½ cup - Moongfalli (Peanuts)
1 - Small Onion
1tsp - Ajwain (Carom Seeds)
1tsp - Jeera (Cumin)
1tsp - Dhanya (Coriander Seed) Powder
5 cloves - Lehsun (Garlic)
As required - Oil

For Cheese Kadhi:

2 cups - Amul Dahi (Curd)
½ tbsp - Besan (Gram Flour)
1tbsp - Cream Cheese
2 - Sookhi Lal Mirch (Dried Red Chilli)
2 tsp - Rai (Mustard Seed)
1sprig - Kadhi Patta (Curry Leaves)
To taste - Salt
To taste - Sugar

For Rairi Rotla:  

1 cup - Gehu ka Ata (Whole Wheat Flour)
1 tbsp - Besan  (Gram Flour)
1tsp - Haldi (Turmeric)
1tsp - Lal Mirch (Red Chilli) Powder
2 tsp - Jeera (Cumin)
1tsp - Ajwain (Carom Seeds)
½ cup - Kacche Aam (Raw mango)
3tsp - Safed Til (Sesame Seeds)
3tsp - Sooji (Semolina flour)
To taste - Salt

For Gajar Sambharyu:

4 - Carrots
1 - Lemon
1 - Green Chilli
To taste - Salt

For Kacche Aam and Hara Lehsun Chutney:

1 cup - Kacche Aam (Raw Mango), grated
3 tsp - Hara Lehsun (Spring Garlic), finely chopped
To taste - Salt and Pepper

For Roohafza Kheer:

¼ cup - Rice
2½ cup - Amul Milk
8 - Almonds
2 tsp - Roohafza
1tsp - Saunf (Fennel Seeds)
2 - Laung (Cloves)
¼” piece - Dalchini (Cinnamon)
1tsp - Amul Ghee
To taste - Sugar

Method:

1. To make Cheese Muthiya: Mix all the ingredients except cheese. 
2. Rub Amul ghee into the ingredients till you get a homogenous mixture.
3. Add water slowly to make a rough dough.
4. Add salt and spices to taste and rest the dough for 20 minutes. 
5. After the dough has been rested divide it into balls and set some aside for later use.
6. Cut the mozzarella into cubes and stuff it into the dough balls.
7. Fry these balls in hot oil until uniformly cooked and the cheese melts. 
8. To make the Lasaniya Bateka nu Shak: Grate potato and fry in hot oil until half cooked and set aside.
9. Make a paste of lal mirch and lehsun. 
10. In a saucepan, heat oil and add ajwain, jeera and moongfalli.
11. Fry properly and add finely chopped onions and cook until pink.
12. Add lal mirch-lehsun paste and cook until the masala releases oil.
13. Add the potatoes and cook until done. 
14. To make the Cheese Kadhi: Make a mixture out of besan, Amul dahi and cream cheese.
15. Whisk it well so that no lumps remain.
16. Slowly cook this mixture in a pan and add a tadka of sookhi lal mirch, rai, kadhi patta. 
17. Cook until the kadhi thickens enough to coat the back of a spoon.
18. To make Kairi Rotla: Make a dough of all the above ingredients except kacche aam, sooji and safed til.
19. Roll flat rotlas and stuff with grated kacche aam. 
20. Coat with sooji and safed til. 
21. Roast the rotlas on a tavaa until crisp.
22. To make the Gajar Sambharyu: Peel the carrots.
23. With the peeler, shave off strips of carrot and marinade in salt, lemon juice, hari mirch and  set aside.
24. To make kacche aam and hara lehsun chutney: Pulverize the ingredients to a fine paste. Season to taste.
25. To make roohafza kheer: Fry the almonds in Amul ghee, chop and set aside. 
26. Boil rice in milk with spices until cooked 
27. Add sugar and roohafza and serve.
28. To assemble the dish: Assemble all the elements of the dish on a platter like a thali. Use satay sticks to present the muthiya rotla and sambharyu. Serve the kadhi in a baldi.

The perfect one-pot, 20-minute dinner is right here: Creamy Potsticker Soup! 🥣  It’s creamy with coconut milk, fragrant with ginger, and so delicious. Get the full recipe details below or in the @allrecipes bio! 🧡

Ingredients: 
1 tablespoon avocado oil
1 bunch green onions, sliced, white and green parts separated
1 quart chicken broth
1 garlic clove, smashed
1 (1 inch ) piece ginger, thinly sliced
2 tablespoons red curry paste
1 tablespoon toasted sesame oil
2 (14 ounce) cans coconut milk
1 cup thinly sliced shiitake mushrooms
1/2 cup shredded carrots
1 (18.2 ounce) bag frozen potstickers, such as P.F. Chang’s® Chicken Dumplings
Sliced green onions and chili crisp for garnish

Directions: 
1. Heat avocado oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add whites from the green onion and saute until softened.

2. Add chicken broth, garlic, ginger, curry paste, and sesame oil. Bring to a boil and simmer for about 10 minutes. 

3. Using a slotted spoon, remove garlic and ginger. Add coconut milk, shiitake mushrooms, and carrots. Bring back to a boil. 

4. Add frozen potstickers and cook until heated through, 6 to 8 minutes. Serve with green part of green onions and chili crisp.

🧑‍🍳: Natalie @guacmylife

Tag you best friends and plan for a coffee hangout 
From @dqcoffeespace 
Specialty coffee is beloved by almost everyone these days, and Double Quotes Coffee Space has been serving delicious coffees for a long time. Now, to add to their line of innovative drinks, they have introduced Cone in a Coffee, where you can sip cold coffee from a chocolate-covered cone. The experience overall was spectacular for a coffee enthusiast like me.
Their innovative LIIT fusion drink, made with mascarpone cheese and flavored coffee, is also something I’ll never forget. Other notable drinks on the menu include thick, rich Italian hot chocolate and matcha green tea latte. They also offer pastries like Korean cream cheese bread to complement their coffees.
One of the few places in Chennai that serves authentic coffees from all over the world, Double Quotes Coffee Space does it better than anywhere else. If you are a coffee enthusiast or a person who loves to explore new variations in coffee, Double Quotes Coffee Space must not be missed!

One of the places in Chennai with an aesthetically pleasing look giving off a Moroccan themed look is Ignna by Midnight Sun.Right from the entrance till the furniture settings,it will give us a vibe which is totally different.
 Out in the outdoor with the breeze,we started with their Arabian Platter which had falafel,hummus,baba ganoush and pita bread-staples of every Middle Eastern Cuisine.
 Next off their chicken shish tawook with tender chicken,onion and pepper gives us the Arabian cuisine feeling.Not just Arabian,their sweet and spicy crispy chicken bao with the softest bao was really good.
 Diavalo pizza with chicken pepperoni with parmesan cheese was cheesy and yummy.
 Finally their Kunafah both taste wise and presentation wise had my heart.
 A place which definitely can be visited just for the vibe!

Ingredients:

For the Champagne and Blueberry Jelly

150ml - Champagne
40g - Castor Sugar
3 - Gelatin Sheets
10 - Blueberries

For the Raspberry Mousse

1 tbsp - Lemon Juice
5 tbsp - Gelatin Powder
1 ½ cup - Raspberries
¼ cup - Sugar
¾ cup - Whipping Cream
Few drops - Red Food Colour
2 - Bird’s Eye Chilies

For the Boondi

1kg - Besan (Gram Flour)
1 ½ kg - Amul Ghee
Few drops - Orange Food Colour
3 cup - Sugar
1 cup - Water

For the Moongfalli Chikki

3 cup - Sugar
2/3 cup - Water
200g - Moongfalli (Peanuts)

For the Pista

300g - Iranian Pista (Pistachio)

For the Crème Anglaise

350 ml - Amul Cream
1 pod - Vanilla
6 - Egg Yolks
70g - Sugar

For the Tuile

1 - Egg White
¼ cup - Maida (Refined Flour)
¼ cup - Sugar
4 tsp - Amul Butter
2 tsp - Amul Cream

Equipment

1 - Terrine Mould
1 - Silicone Mat

Method:

To make the Champagne Jelly

1. Melt the Champagne and the Sugar together over a low flame.
2. Soak the gelatin leaves in some water for 2 minutes
3. Squeeze out the excess water from the gelatin and stir into the warm champagne mixture.
4. Once melted, strain and pour into the terrine mould. 
5. Place the blueberries in the jelly
6. Refrigerate.

To make Raspberry Mousse

1. Pour lemon juice over the gelatine and allow to bloom.
2. Strain the raspberry puree and mix in the sugar
3. Heat the Raspberry mixture till it bubbles at the edges.
4. Add the Gelatin and mix well.
5. Whip the cream, and once the raspberry mix is cooled fold the two together.
6. Chop the bird’s eye chillies fine and fold into the mousse.
7. Refrigerate

To make Moongfali Chikki

1. Melt the sugar and water together until you get a single string consistency
2. Pour the caramel onto a silicone mat and cover with the peanuts
3. Crush and keep aside.

To make  Boondi

1. Melt the sugar and water together to make a chashni.
2. Heat the ghee on a high flame.
3. Make a thick batter off the besan with water.
4. Hold a perforated spoon full of the batter over the hot ghee and allow the drops to fall and form boondi in the hot ghee. (If your boondi has tails your mixture is too thin. Adjust with some more besan).
5. Add colour to the chashni sugar syrup
6. Remove the fried boondis and dunk in the coloured chashni and leave to soak in.

To make  Pista Layer

1. Blach and chop the pistas fine and set aside

To make  Crème Anglaise

1. Heat the Amul cream (but do not boil)
2. Whisk the egg yolks and sugar together.
3. Take the cream off the fire. Mix the heated cream with the egg yolk mixture, strain and return to the heat
4. Add the torn Basil
5. Once cooked and the custard coats the back of the wooden spoon, remove from fire and keep aside.

To make  Tuile

1. Mix all the ingredients together.
2. Using a stencil draw circles on a butter paper.
3. Turn the butter paper over. Using the back of a spoon, spread a thin layer of the batter onto the circles.
4. Bake at 170°C for 4-5 minutes.

Final Layering

Layer 1: Champagne Jelly
Layer 2: Raspberry Mousse
Layer 3: Boondi
Layer 4: Pista
Layer 5 Chikki

Final Presentation:

Serve a slice of cassata with Crème anglaise sauce and blueberries on the side, topped with the tuile garnish

ngredients:

For the Pasta Dough:

½ cup - India Gate Basmati Rice, ground into a fine powder
½ cup - Maida (Refined Flour)
1tsp - Salt
1tsp - Haldi (Turmeric)
1tsp - Lal Mirch (Red Chilli) Powder
2 - Eggs
2 tsp - Moongphalli ka tel (Groundnut Oil)
2tsp - Olive oil

For the stuffing:

1 cup - Chicken Mince
5 - Badi Elaichi (Black Cardamom)
4 - Choti Elaichi (Green Cardamom)
10 - Kashmiri Mirch (Dried Kashmiri Chilli)
8 cloves - Lehsun (Garlic)    
4 tsp - Jeera (Cumin) Powder
3 tsp - Dhanya (Coriander Seeds)
1 tsp - Haldi (Turmeric) powder
2 tsp - Lal Mirch (Red Chilli) Powder
1 cup - Amul Dahi (Curd)
1 - Large Onion    
½ cup - India Gate basmati rice
To taste - Salt
As required - Oil

For the Sol Kadhi Sauce:

2 cups - Coconut milk
¼ cup - Kokum
2 sprigs - Kadhi Patta (Curry leaves)
1” piece - Adrak (Ginger)
2 - Hari Mirch (Green Chilli)
1bunch - Hara Dhanya (Coriander Leaves)
1 - Onion
½ tsp - Hing (Asafoetida) 
2 tsp - Rai (Mustard Seeds)     
4 cloves - Garlic 
To taste - Salt

Method:
 
1. To make the pasta dough: Make a dough of one whole egg and one egg yolk and all the remaining ingredients. (Set aside the remaining egg white to seal the ravioli later).
2. For the stuffing: Make a paste with lal mirch and lehsun and set aside. Broil jeera and dhanya separately to make a powder.
3. Cook the rice with salt over a medium flame till done.
4. Take oil in pan add black and green cardamom let sputter.
5. Add onion and fry but make sure you don’t brown the onion too much because this will spoil the gravy. 
6. Add the lal mirch paste to the pan and let it cook till it gives out oil.
7. Add chicken mince and cook well.
8. At this point, make a mixture of Amul dahi, lal mirch powder, haldi, dhanya powder and whisk well so there are no lumps.
9. Add this mixture to the pan and cook for a while on simmer. Add the jeera powder and adjust salt.
10. When the mince is done, remove from flame and set aside to cool.
11. The rice should also be cooked at this point.
12. To make the Sol Kadhi sauce and infusion: Take some oil in a sauce pan add ½ the hara dhanya bunch.
13. Keeping the flame as low as possible, add crushed lehsun to make an infusion.
14. In another saucepan, boil the kokum in water to extract its color and juices.
15. Slice onion fine and fry in hot oil till golden brown and crispy. Remove with a perforated spoon and set this brista aside. Discard the oil.
16. In the same pan add coconut milk and the kokum extract and cook until all the flavours have amalgamated.
17. Cut adrak juliennes and finely chop dhanya sprigs and hari mirch.
18. Temper the adrak juliennes, hari mirch, the remaining hara dhanya, kadhi patta, rai, hing and add this to the coconut milk and kokum.
19. Cook for a while and add salt if necessary. 
20. By this time your dhanya and lehsun infusion will be ready. Strain it with muslin cloth and set aside.
21. To assemble the dish: Pass the pasta dough several times through the pasta machine on a wide setting so that it becomes pliable.
22. Pass it through a narrow setting and cut discs from this thin sheet of dough.
23. Place a bit of the stuffing on a disc. Take another disc and brush its edges with the remaining egg white and place it over the disc with the stuffing and press the edges together to seal.
24. Press the edges with a fork to give them distinct ravioli design.
25. Poach the pasta in hot boiling water with added salt for 5 - 8 minutes, checking occasionally to see if it’s done.
26. Place the cooked pasta in a soup plate, pour some of the sol kadhi sauce over.
27. Sprinkle some brista over it and drizzle it with some infusion.

Ingredients:

For the Canapé base:
1 kg - Maida (Refined Flour)
250g - Sooji (Semolina)
2 cups - Refined flour
200ml - Oil
1 tsp - Ajwain (Carom Seeds)
As required - Water
To taste - Salt

For the 1st topping:
1 big - Karela (Bitter Gourd)
1 - Red Bell Pepper, chopped
1 - Yellow Bell Pepper, chopped
1 - Green Bell Pepper, chopped
2 - Medium Tomatoes, chopped 
¼ tsp - Kali Mirch (Black Pepper) Powder
2 tsp - Sugar
To taste - Salt
200g - Amul Mozzarella Cheese
To garnish - Olives

For the 2nd topping:
1 box - Amul Cheese Spread
2 tsp - Amul Fresh Cream
1 tsp - Mustard Paste
To taste - Salt
¼ tsp - Kali Mirch (Black Pepper) Powder

For the 3rd topping:
1 - Big Karela (Bitter Gourd)
1 cup - Grated Chocolate
½ cup - Walnut, chopped

For the 4th topping:
2 cups - Amul Cream
½ cup - Castor Sugar
2 tsp - Roohafza
1 - Big Karela (Bitter Gourd)
2 tsp - White Vinegar
2 tsp - Sugar

For the 5th topping:
2 cups - Amul Cream
½ cup - Castor Sugar
2 tsp - Khus Syrup
1 - Big Karela (Bitter Gourd)
2 tsp - White Vinegar
2 tsp - Sugar

For the 6th topping:
1 cup - Whipped Cream
1 cup - Amul Cheese Spread
1 cup - Mixed Tropical Fruits, chopped

For garnishing
Mango and Black Grapes

Method:

1. To make the canapé base: Combine all ingredients and make a dough with water. 
2. Make balls of the dough and roll out into small flat puris.
3. Pierce with a fork and deep fry over medium heat.
4. Divide the canapés into 6 portions.
5. To make the 1st topping: Marinate the karela whole with plenty of salt and set aside for 15 minutes.
6. After that wash the karela and cut into small pieces. 
7. Then fry in oil and mix all the ingredients together.
8. Spoon onto a portion of the canapés.
9. Top with mozzarella cheese and bake for 5-7 minutes.  
10. Remove and garnish with olive slices.
11. To make the 2nd topping: Mix all the ingredients together and spread over a portion of the canapés. 
12. To make the 3rd topping: marinate the karela with salt for 15 minutes.
13. Wash and cut into round slices and deep fry.
14. Melt chocolate in a double boiler and make chikki with the karela roundels and walnuts.
15. Crumble over a portion of the canapés.
16. To make the 4th topping: Boil karela with 2 tsp sugar, white vinegar and salt till tender.
17. Drain and grind it. 
18. Whip the cream with castor sugar then mix Roohafza and karela. 
19. Strain the mixture and then spoon into a piping bag.
20. Pipe the mixture onto a portion of the canapés. 
21. Garnish with silver balls.    
22. To make the 5th topping: Boil karela with 2 tsp sugar, white vinegar and salt till tender.
23. Drain and grind it. 
24. Whip the cream with castor sugar then mix khus syrup and karela. 
25. Strain the mixture and then spoon into a piping bag.
26. Pipe the mixture onto a portion of the canapés. 
27. Garnish with chives and candy.    
28. To make the 6th topping:  Mix together all ingredients and spread over remaining canapés.
29. Garnish with black grapes and sliced mangoes.

Ingredients:

For the Hummus:
200g - Kabuli Channa (Chickpeas), soaked and boiled
To taste - Tahini
To taste - Salt
5 tsps - Lemon Juice
To taste - Safed Mirch (White Pepper) Powder
To taste - Paprika Powder
½ - Chukandar (Beetroot)
5 cloves - Lehsun (Garlic)
10 tsps - Extra Virgin Olive Oil

For the Flat Bread:
12g - Yeast
½ tsp - Sugar
150g - Maida (Refined Flour)
To taste - Salt

For the Baba Ganoush:
2 - Baingans (Brinjals)
10 tsps - Extra Virgin Olive Oil
7 cloves - Lehsun (Garlic), chopped
To taste - Salt
3 tsp - Tahini
2 tsp - Kali Mirch (Black Pepper) Powder
1 cup - Flat leaf Parsley, finely chopped
4 tsp - Lemon Juice
1 - Coal Sigdi

For the Tzatziki:
1 cup - Amul Curd, Hung in a muslin cloth for 30 minutes
4 tsp - Cucumber, finely chopped
2 cloves - Lehsun (Garlic), finely chopped
2 tsp - Soa (Dill Leaves)
2 tsp - Extra Virgin Olive Oil
1 tsp - Lemon Juice

For the Falafel:
2 cups - Kabuli Channa (Chickpeas), soaked overnight
½ cup - Onion, chopped
2 cloves - Lehsun (Garlic)
½ cup - Parsley, chopped
1 tsp - Jeera (Cumin)
To taste - Salt
For frying - Olive Oil

For the Shish Tawook:
2 - Chicken Breasts, cut into 1” slices
½ “ - piece Dry Ginger
½ tsp - Methi Dana (Fenugreek Seeds)
½ stick - Dalchini (Cinnamon)
½ tsp - Kali Mirch (Black Pepper) Powder
½ tsp - Grated Jaiphal (Nutmeg)
2 tsp - Paprika Powder
½ tsp - Jeera (Cumin)
5 tsp - Lemon Juice
4 tsp - Olive Oil
6 cloves - Lehsun (Garlic), chopped
As required - Satay Sticks, soaked in water for 24 hours

Method:

1. To make the hummus: Soak kabuli channa for 12 hours.
2. Cover with twice the amount of water and boil with salt till soft
3. Remove as many skins from the kabuli channa as you can.
4. Blend kabuli channa together with lehsun, chukandar, lemon juice and olive oil in a mixer-grinder.
5. Strain the mixture with a soup strainer to remove lumps.
6. Pour the mixture into a bowl and add extra virgin olive oil and paprika powder to garnish.
7. Put it in the fridge to cool.
8. To make the flat bread: Dissolve the sugar and yeast in a little lukewarm water and set aside.
9. In a bowl combine the yeast mixture, maida and salt with enough water to make a dough.
10. Rest the dough for 20 minutes.
11. Make 4-5 balls of the dough and roll out thick chapattis and roast over a tavaa.
12. To make baba ganoush: Roast baingan over a coal sigdi. 
13. When done remove the skin, split lengthways and scoop out the seeds.
14. Mash the baingan flesh with a fork till smooth.
15. Add lehsun, salt, kali mirch powder, tahini, extra virgin olive oil and parsley.
16. To make the tzatziki: Mix all ingredients together and put in the fridge to chill.
17. To make the falafel: Blend soaked kabuli channa in a mixer-grinder.
18. Make small balls of the mixture.
19. Fill oil in a deep kadai and heat over a high flame till very hot.
20. Deep fry the balls till they are crisp on the outside and soft inside.
21. To make shish tawook: Dry roast all spices and dry ginger and grind to a fine dust. 
22. Strain to remove lumps.
23. Take a bowl add dry spice powder as per taste.
24. Add olive oil, chop lehsun, lemon juice and salt and mix well.
25. Add chicken and marinate for 30 minutes.
26. Spike the chicken strips on satay sticks and roast it over a low heat on a charcoal sigdi for 10 minutes turning frequently.
27.  Serve all the dishes together as a Lebanese mezze platter.

Get the recipe in the comments ⬇️

Ingredients:

For the Puris:
1 cup - Fine Sooji (Semolina)
4 tsp - Maida (Refined Flour)
¼ tsp - Baking Soda
1 tsp - Dried Thyme
¼ tsp - Salt
20ml - Oil (in dough)
As required - Oil (for deep frying)

For the filling:
1 cup - Kaccha Aam (Raw Mango), grated
1 cup - Makai (Corn), chopped
1 cup - Ankuri (Mixed Sprouts)
2 tsp - Lehsun (Garlic), chopped
1/5 cup - Onion, chopped
To taste - Salt
1 tsp - Kali Mirch (Black Pepper) Powder
3 tsp - Sugar
3 tsp - Bhuna Jeera (Roasted Cumin Seeds), crushed 

For the Pani:
2 - Apples
4 - Oranges
1 stick - Dalchini (Cinnamon)
4 pieces - Kokum
1 tsp - Garam Masala
To taste - Salt
2 tsp - Kali Mirch (Black Pepper) Powder
1/5 cup - Sugar
3 tsp - Bhuna Jeera (Roasted Cumin Seeds)
¼ cup - Pudina (Mint)
½ cup - Almonds   
                            
Method:

1. To make the puri: Combine the sooji, maida, baking soda and salt with a little water to form a firm dough.
2. Grind the thyme to a very fine powder and sieve it through a tea strainer. Discard the big particles.
3. Add to the dough.
4. Knead for a full 5 minutes.
5. Allow the dough to rest for half an hour.
6. After the dough has rested heat oil in a kadai till very hot.
7. Break off small balls of dough and roll out and deep fry.
8. Fry only a few puris at a time, rolling them out as you go. This will ensure the oil stays at the right temperature.
9. Hold the puris down in the oil with a perforated spoon till they puff up.
10. Fry till golden brown then remove and place on tissue paper to soak up excess oil.
11. To make the filling: Boil makai and mixed ankuri.
12. In another pan, sauté lehsun and onion.
13. Add kacche aam and sugar to balance the tanginess.
14. When the kacche aam turns yellow, add chopped makai and mixed ankuri.
15. Finish with salt, kali mirch and jeera powder.
16. To make the pani: Extract juice from the oranges and reduce with dalchini and sugar.
17. Extract juice from the apples
18. Boil kokum in water to extract flavor and mix the three juices together.
19. In the end, add chopped almonds, mint and all the spices.
20. To eat, make a hole in the top of the puri with your finger or thumb.
21. Fill the puri with the filling and top up with the pani.

Ingredients:

For the Sabja layer:
3kg - Sabja (Tulsi seeds)
To soak 1kg sabja - Water
To soak 1kg sabja - Khus Syrup
To soak 1kg sabja - Roohafza

For the Roohafza Jelly:
18 tbsp - Gelatin
2 ½ cups - Cold Water
20 cups - Roohafza
5 cups - Water, at room temperature
2 ½ tsp - Salt

For the Orange Jelly: 
18 tbsp - Gelatin
2 ½ cups - Cold Water
5 cups - Water, at room temperature
2 cups - Lemon Juice
2 ½ tsp - Salt
10 cup - Orange Juice
5 cups - Sugar

For the Reduced Milk:
6 lt. - Milk
300g - Mawa
400g - Sugar

For the Mango Mousse:
4.25 kg - Mango Pulp
10 tbsp - Gelatin
5 cups - Amul Curd
7 cups - Whipping Cream (before whipping)
1 ½ cups - Water

For the Granola:
2 kg - White Chocolate
1 kg - Crunchy Muesli

For the Red Falooda Sevai:
3 cups - Roohafza
3 cups - Water
6 cups - Corn flour

For the Mixed Fruit:
5 - Watermelons
5 - Pineapples
5 - Papayas
5 bunches - Black Grapes
20 - Strawberries
20 - Kiwis

For the Sugar Work:
As desired Granulated Sugar

Method:

Step 1 : To make the sabja: 
Soak 1 kg sabja seeds in water, 1 kg in Roohafza and the remaining 1kg in khus syrup.

Step 2 : To make the Roohafza jelly: 
1. Mix gelatin in cold water.
2. Boil water and dissolve the gelatin mixture in it.
3. Mix Roohafza and salt with the dissolved gelatin mixture.
4. Pour into a mould and place it in the freezer to set. 

Step 3 : To make the orange jelly: 
1. Mix gelatin in cold water.
2. Boil water and dissolve the gelatin mixture in it.
3. Add salt, sugar and lemon juice to the boiling gelatin mixture.
4. Cool the gelatin mixture and pour into the mould.
5. Add orange juice and stir well.
6. Place in the freezer to set.

Step 4 : To make the reduced milk: 
1. Heat milk in a large pot.
2. When the milk has reduced a little bit, add mawa and stir.
3. When the milk has thickened slightly, add sugar and stir till dissolved.
4. Continue to simmer the milk till it has reduced to almost half its original quantity.
5. Take the reduced milk off the flame and set aside to cool.

Step 5 : To make the mango mousse: 
1. Melt gelatin in water.
2. Whip the whipping cream and place in the fridge.
3. Using a muslin cloth, drain some of the water from the curd to make it thicker.
4. Mix the mango pulp and the curd. 
5. Add gelatin and lightly mix.
6. Fold the whipped cream into the mango pulp and curd mixture (make sure that the mixture is combined well. If you don’t do this, the layers will separate when the mousse is setting).
7. Pour into a mould and place in the freezer to set.

Step 6 : To make the granola: 
1. Melt chocolate in a double boiler and set aside to cool for some time
2. Pour the chocolate over muesli and mix
3. Line a baking tray with butter paper.
4. Spread the mixture on the baking tray.
5. Place it in the freezer to set. 

Step 7 : To make the red falooda sevai: 
1. Take corn flour in a pot.
2. In a separate bowl, dissolve Roohafza in water.
3. Add the Roohafza mixture to the corn flour.
4. Mix well till corn flour is dissolved.
5. Place the pot over a high flame and bring to a boil while stirring continuously.
6. Keep stirring till the mixture becomes thick, leaves the sides of the pot and turns almost transparent. 
7. Turn off the gas.
8. While the mixture is still hot, spoon it into a sevai maker and press out the falooda noodles it into ice-cold water (make sure you press out the whole batter in one go. Do not wait for it to cool or the batter will become rubbery and unusable).
9. Let the noodles remain in the cold water. Strain the noodles just before you are ready to assemble your falooda.

Step 8 : To prepare the mix fruits: 
1. Cut the fruit into large wedges. 

Step 9 : To make the sugar work: 
1. Heat sugar in a pan till it has melted and turned a golden caramel colour.
2. Use a spoon to drizzle in a random pattern over a silicon mat and allow to cool.
Final Assembly

Layer 1: Roohafza Sabza
Layer 2: Granola ( Broken into big Pieces)
Layer 3: Fruit Wedges
Layer 4: Khus Sabza
Layer 5: Orange Jelly ( Cut into Diamonds/ Cubes)
Layer 6: Black Grapes
Layer 7: Reduced Milk
Layer 8: Red Sev
Layer 9: Plain Sabza
Layer 10: Roohafza Jelly ( Cut into Diamonds/ Cubes)
Layer 11: Mango Mousse
Layer 12: Fruit Wedges

Finally Garnish with the Sugar Work.

Ingredients:

For the Aubergine Chicken:

2 - Chicken Breasts
10 - Tomatoes
1 - White Onion  
10 cloves - Lehsun (Garlic)
1 - Large Baingan (Eggplant)
To taste - Salt
To taste - Kali Mirch (Pepper)
For dusting - Maida (Refined Flour)
To taste - Dry Basil
1 - Lemon

For the tortellini:

100g - Maida (Refined Flour)
1 - Egg
To taste - Salt
1 - White Onions
3 cloves - Lehsun (Garlic)
10 leaves - Mithi Tulsi (Basil)
15 - Button Mushrooms

For the Pesto:

¼ cup - Chilgoza (Pine Nuts)
1 cup - Mithi Tulsi (Basil)
¼  cup - Parmesan Cheese
5 – 6 cloves - Lehsun (Garlic)
To taste - Extra Virgin Olive Oil
To taste - Salt

For the sautéed vegetables:

1 - Broccoli
1 - Carrots
50g - Amul Butter
5 cloves - Lehsun (Garlic)
To taste - Kali Mirch (Black Pepper)
To taste - Salt
To taste - Lemon 

For the crushed potato:

6 - Potato baby
To taste - Lemon
To taste - Butter
To taste - Kali Mirch (Black Pepper)

Method:

1. To make the aubergine chicken: Blanch the tomatoes.
2. Peel the blanched tomatoes and deseed.
3. Chop and begin to cook for the sauce.
4. Add chopped onion, garlic and salt.
5. Cover and cook for around 20 minutes over a medium flame, stirring occasionally.
6. Cut the eggplant into large flat squares. 
7. Immerse in salty water.
8. Marinate with salt, kali mirch, lehsun and dust with a little maida.
9. Grill in a grilling pan.
10. Marinate the chicken with salt, kali mirch, lemon, lehsun and dry basil.
11. Grill in a grilling pan.
12. Check the cake, remove cake from the oven and after a few seconds, demould it and serve.
13. To make the stuffing for the tortellini: sauté chopped mushroom, onion, lehsun, salt and two leaves of mithi tulsi.
14. To make the tortellini: Make a dough of flour, egg and a pinch of salt. Sprinkle some water if needed.
15. Knead and work it with your hands for quite a while to develop the gluten in the flour.
16. Knead until your pasta starts to feel smooth and silky instead of rough and floury. Wrap it in cling film and put it in the fridge to rest for at least half an hour before you use it. 
17. Remove from fridge and take a lump and flatten a little with your fingers.
18. Pass through a pasta machine on the narrowest setting several times till it is rolled out very thin.
19. Once you've rolled your pasta the way you want it, shape or cut it straight away because fresh pasta dries very fast.
20. Lay your pasta sheet out and cut into squares.
21. Spoon a little stuffing onto each square and fold one end of the square over diagonally to meet the other (so that you are left with a triangle).
22. Bring the two base ends of the triangle together and pinch shut.
23. Boil in hot water for about 3 – 4 minutes (longer if the size of your tortellini is bigger).
24. To make the pesto sauce: grind the mithi tulsi, lehsun ,chilgoza ,olive oil, salt and lemon.
25. Saute the tortellini with the pesto so that it is covered lightly.
26. For the sautéed vegetables: saute broccoli and carrot with lehsun, butter, salt kali mirch and lemon .
27. For the crushed potato: Boil baby potatoes with a little salt.
28. Crush the baby potatoes and saute lightly with butter lemon and kali mirch

From @girijapaati 
Recently, I had the pleasure of tasting traditional South Indian sweets, snacks, pickles, and spices crafted by Girija Paati, a 72-year-old grandma from Chennai. What’s remarkable is that she started this venture at her age, proving that pursuing your passion knows no age limit.

Girija Paati’s recipes have been in her family for generations, some dating back 100 years. What makes her creations special is that she only uses natural ingredients, without any preservatives or artificial stuff. The result? Authentic flavors that make you feel like you’re in South India.

Among the delicious treats I tried, a few stood out:

1. Milagai Curry - Tamarind Green Chilli Pickle
2. Spicy Thattai
3. Butter Maaladdu
4. Classic Mixture
5. Mysore Pak
6. Badusha
7. Garlic Karuvaipillai Podi
8. Mangai Thokku
9. Idli Milagai Podi
10. Sev Murukku

Each of these had a unique taste that made my taste buds dance! What’s inspiring about Girija Paati is her dedication to creating not only tasty but also healthy options for fitness enthusiasts.

In conclusion, Girija Paati’s treats are not just about food; they’re a story of tradition, passion, and never giving up on your dreams. If you’re a fan of South Indian flavors, I strongly recommend giving them a try.
